channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Ongoing fly tipping problem, 14th December
item.description:
Once again this green bin is overflowing with flytipped waste and is blowing down Grove Lane. We have to sweep multiple times a day to deal with rubbish that isnâ€™t ours - please come up with a permanent solution.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Cuthill Walk, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dulwich Village roundabout, 14th December
item.description:
Dangerous roundabout. Over the last year there have been multiple serious incidents where cyclists have been knocked off bikes. Injuries include an open tibial fracture and another with facial fractures requiring surgery. Children cycle around this roundabout daily and cars speed across it, The signage is inadequate on college and gallery road leading to drivers being confused and stopping suddenly. The end of Burbage road junction is also dangerous with traffic looking right and hitting cyclist to their left,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gallery Road, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More or less where indicated, 14th December
item.description:

item.title: Loose manhole cover, loud bang sound when car passes by, 14th December
item.description:
Every time a vehicle drives over it, especially busses, it makes a very loud banging noise, especially at night. The noise is constant and is disturbing sleep for nearby residents. The cover appears to move when vehicles pass over it and may also present a potential safety risk.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Weigall Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on the green space on Tabard park, 14th December
item.description:

item.title: Pedestrian route between The Terrace and St Julian's Road. Up against wall of Ryde House., 14th December
item.description:
Loads of black bagged waste dumped around a big blue bin (this bin should be removed or taken into a building as people just throw anything into it). Other furniture and fly tipped waste too.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): The Terrace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
